Class Connect4Model

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
connect4.Connect4Model
public class Connect4Model extends Observable
This class defines methods to handle game logic, including making moves, updating the game board, and checking for game-over conditions.

  • Method Details

    • saveGame

      public boolean saveGame()
      Saves the current game board and player turn to a .dat file as a Connect4Instance object
      Returns:
      a boolean which means game save was successful

    • setPlayers

      public void setPlayers(String[] playerNames)
      Sets the player name's array for the model
      Parameters:
      playerNames - - a String[] which holds player 1 and 2's names

    • getPlayers

      public String[] getPlayers()
      Retrieves player 1 and 2's names in a String Array
      Returns:
      a String[] which holds player 1 and 2's names

    • getBoard

      public char[][] getBoard()
      Retrieves the current Connect4 game
      Returns:
      a char[][] which holds all player's pieces

    • setBoard

      public void setBoard(char[][] board)
      Sets a board to a different game board
      Parameters:
      board - - an array of arrays of chars which is a game board

    • getTurn

      public char getTurn()
      Retrieves which ever player's turn it is
      Returns:
      a char which represents the player color

    • setTurn

      public void setTurn(char player)
      Sets a the next player's turn
      Parameters:
      player - - a char which represents the player color

    • setMove

      public void setMove(int col)
      Adds a player piece to game board
      Parameters:
      col - - int that represents a board column

    • isGameOver

      public int isGameOver(int row, int col)
      Checks if board is full of pieces or if a player has connected 4 pieces
      Parameters:
      row - - an int which is the row a piece landed in
      col - - an int which is the column a piece was dropped in
      Returns:
      an int, 1(Game over by winner), 0 (Not game over), -1 (Game over by draw).

    • isWinner

      private boolean isWinner(int row, int col)
      Checks if there's a winner from all possible directions for the last move
      Parameters:
      row - - an int which is the row a piece landed in
      col - - an int which is the column a piece was dropped in
      Returns:
      a boolean where true is the player has won and false no winner.

    • checkDiagonal

      private boolean checkDiagonal(int row, int col, char player)
      Checks if there are four connected pieces diagonally from a coordinate
      Parameters:
      row - - an int which is the row a piece landed in
      col - - an int which is the column a piece was dropped in
      player - - a char which represents the player color
      Returns:
      a boolean, true if there are at least four connected player pieces diagonally

    • checkHorizontal

      private boolean checkHorizontal(int row, int col, char player)
      Checks if there are four connected pieces horizontally from a coordinate
      Parameters:
      row - - an int which is the row a piece landed in
      col - - an int which is the column a piece was dropped in
      player - - a char which represents the player color
      Returns:
      a boolean, true if there are at least four connected player pieces horizontally

    • checkVertical

      private boolean checkVertical(int row, int col, char player)
      Checks if there are four connected pieces vertically from a coordinate
      Parameters:
      row - - an int which is the row a piece landed in
      col - - an int which is the column a piece was dropped in
      player - - a char which represents the player color
      Returns:
      a boolean, true if there are at least four connected player pieces vertically

    • countConnected

      private int countConnected(int row, int col, int xDir, int yDir, char player)
      Checks if there are four of a players pieces in a row going a certain direction
      Parameters:
      row - - an int which is the row a piece landed in
      col - - an int which is the column a piece was dropped in
      xDir - - an int which is the direction x is going to move towards
      yDir - - an int which is the direction y is going to move towards
      player - - a char which represents the player color
      Returns:
      a int which is the count of the number of connected pieces in a direction
